types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time in the UTC
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string, including UTC timezone ("Z"). The parsed date and time string will
be converted to UTC and any UTC offset other than 0 will be rejected.

types.name: Money
types.description: The `Money` scalar type represents a type for money numbers.

args.name: fromMemberId
args.description: Member w/ a source money transfer.

args.name: toMemberId
args.description: Member w/ a destination money transfer.

fields.name: setDefaultWallet
fields.description: Set the wallet as a default wallet for the owner.

args.name: id
args.description: Wallet's Snowflake ID to set as a default wallet.

args.name: isSuspended
args.description: A flag indicating the organization's account is suspended.

args.name: isSuspended
args.description: A flag indicating the person's account is suspended.

fields.name: isSuspended
fields.description: A flag indicating the organization's account is suspended.

fields.name: registeredAt
fields.description: Date and time when organization's account was created.

types.name: Person

fields.name: isSuspended
fields.description: A flag indicating the person's account is suspended.

fields.name: registeredAt
fields.description: Date and time when person's account was created.

types.description: A person is an individual's account.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Get an organization by it's Snowflake ID.

fields.name: person
fields.description: Get a person by it's Snowflake ID.

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: Get a transaction by it's Snowflake ID.

fields.name: wallet
fields.description: Get a wallet by it's Snowflake ID.

types.name: Snowflake
types.description:
The `Snowflake` scalar type represents a unique object's ID called
Snowflake ID. Snowflake ID is a 64 bit integer. Note that the
Snowflake ID values are returned as strings.

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Transaction

fields.name: fromMember
fields.description: Member w/ a source money transfer.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Date and time when transaction was created.

fields.name: toMember
fields.description: Member w/ a destination money transfer.

types.description: Transaction represents a money transfer between two members (person or organization).

types.name: Wallet

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when wallet was created.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.description: A flag indicating the wallet is deleted.

types.description: Wallet represents a credit/debit card or bank account.

types.name: __Type
types.description: Represents scalars, interfaces, object types, unions, enums in the system

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true."

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
